content: Bij opnieuw installeren raakt u geen gegevens kwijt, het profiel zou moeten worden herkend en gebruikt. Het is niet uitgesloten dat er een bestand beschadigd is in uw huidige installatie, waardoor Thunderbird niet goed werkt. Een herinstallatie zou dat moeten verhelpen. U kunt voor alle zekerheid voordat u een nieuwe installatie uitvoert een reservekopie van uw profiel maken: Uw Thunderbird-profiel exporteren. Mocht u na een herinstallatie toch geen berichten meer zien, dan zijn ze niet kwijt, maar kan Thunderbird ze niet vinden. Daar zijn ook oplossingen voor, dus geen zorgen.

creator: awitting

content:
Ik heb een soortgelijk bericht gevonden in https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1489019. Een heel uitgebreid antwoord, maar wellicht is dat wat onderaan staat een mogelijkheid:

  • Sluit Thunderbird af.
  • In windows search type: %Appdata%
  • Select the %Appdata% file folder
  • Click on 'Roaming'
  • Click on 'Thunderbird'
  • Click on 'Profiles'
  • Click on the profile name folder
  • delete the 'compatibility.ini' file [ ik zou het bestand niet verwijderen, maar hernoemen naar compatibility.oud]
  • start Thunderbird
creator: Mozilla-assistent

content:
Ik kom er nog niet uit. Moet ik via verkenner van Windows zoeken naar %Appdata% ? Als ik dat doe dan krijg een hele lange lijst met bestanden en folders, waar Appdata (dus zonder %......%) in bestandlocaties voorkomt. Geen idee hoe ik dan verder moet of wat ik dan moet kiezen.

Kun je misschien een nadere toelichting geven hoe ik moet handelen?

Met vriendelijke groet, Albert Wittingen

      • @kpnmail.nl
creator: awitting

content: Uit mijn hoofd zijn het de volgende stappen: Appdata > Roaming > Thunderbird > Profiles > [profielnaam] > daarna stappen hierboven. Als er meerdere profielmappen zijn, ga ze dan voor de volledigheid allemaal af en creëer compatibility.ini in elke map opnieuw. Start na elke aanpassing in een profielmap Thunderbird opnieuw om te kijken of de knop het weer doet.
creator: markh2

content: Ik heb na lang zoeken de map Appdata gevonden, maar er was me niet bekend dat het een verborgen map was. Dus eerst unhide gedaan. Zie de foto's van de map en de ini file. De ini file staat trouwens niet in de profile map. Moet ik de profiles.ini file nu een andere naam geven? Ik begrijp niet de term compatibility, die nu ineens genoemd wordt in jullie beantwoording.
creator: awitting

content: Het bestand profiles.ini moet u ongemoeid laten! Kijk of het bestand compatibility.ini bestaat in de map met de naam qne2e02g.default. Als dit bestaat dan kunt u dat bestand hernoemen naar compatibility.oud (met Thunderbird afgesloten).
creator: Mozilla-assistent

content:
OK, ik kreeg zojuist antwoord van een Thunderbird-ontwikkelaar: Make sure you have your desired account as the default account in Account Settings (go to account settings and Set As Default on an account of your choosing- you should see the golden star next to your account).

Ga dus naar de Accountinstellingen, selecteer een account en maak deze standaard. Ik heb nu helaas geen Thunderbird bij de hand voor een schermafdruk.

Ik heb het bestand compatibilty.ini gewijzigd naar de extensie .oud. Daarna PC uit en weer aangezet en Thunderbird opgestart. Echter de knop "nieuw emailbericht" werkte nog niet".

content:
Ciao, purtroppo le risposte alla tue domande non sono semplici. Anzitutto non è chiaro cosa hai fatto di preciso.

Quando scrivi Ho esportato dalla mia casella PEC di Altapec, che dovevo svuotare, il contenuto delle cartelle PEC IN ARRIVO, INVIATE e delle BOZZE cosa intendi? hai scaricato dei file sul tuo computer? In che formato? O intendi che hai scaricato la posta in queste cartelle con Thunderbird?

L'altro elemento da chiarire è il protocollo utilizzato. Se hai usato POP3, la copia in Thunderbird è indipendente dal sever. Se -come sembre- hai usato IMAP la copia in Thunderbird è sincronizzata con il server; qualsiasi cosa fai su Thunderbird o sul server viene immediatamente replicata su entrambi. Ciò che descrivi è esattamente quello che succede quando usi IMAP e Thunderbird trova la cartelle sul server vuote: svuota anche le proprie per mantenere la sincronizzazione. In questo senso IMAP è un'arma a doppio taglio da usare solo se si padroneggiamo i suoi meccanismi. In genere basta infatti copiare o spostare le email sotto Cartelle Locali di Thunderbird per sottrarle alla sincronizzazione e tenerle slavate in locale.

Quindi prima si aggiungere altro, puoi chiarire questi due punti?

content:
Settings/Privacy & Security, Saved Passwords, remove entries for the account, restart TB, enter new password in OAuth window to allow access.

Scam messages supposedly using your account, demanding payment 'or else', are a common scam.

content: You weren't hacked, just 'spoofed', as proven by your ability to change the password (unless your system is truly infected by malware). This has nothing to do with TB, and the only possible glitch is the obsolete entries in Saved Passwords. You might see these scams again, but generally they can be ignored. The sender preys on people's unawareness of such ploys.

content: That’s a common situation and definitely possible to fix. You can manually copy the mail folders (like Inbox, Sent, etc.) from the backup profile into the new one using a tool like ImportExportTools NG in Thunderbird. Just make sure to back everything up before merging.

creator: gerald.ten

content:
If you have activated iCloud and the two factor authentication for TB on your Mac you may create a CardDav address book to synchronise your macOS "Contacts" with TB. In the Address Book tab toolbar click on "New Address Book" and choose "Add CardDav Address Book" (image 1) This opens a new address book wizard (image 2): As "Username" fill in the email address which you have declared for your Apple account. In the second line "Location" fill in the following URL https://contacts.icloud.com/contacts/ 

and click "Continue".

In the next dialogue box you'll have to fill in the password received by Apple when you activated the two factor authentication, ....etc and at the end you can give a name for your new address book

content: Why are you running 32 bit anything on a 64 bit machine? Nothing has been altered at all - upgrades, power outages, etc? earthlink+AOL+verizon could be a raft of issues - could you provide any more details?
creator: jeff-g

content:
Thanks for the reply, jeff-g. To your second question: no, nothing changed within my awareness. Just stopped working. Third question: I've used three e-mail providers for many years, for a variety of reasons including security (anonymity + throwaway addresses), control (I own two of the domains) and separating work from personal mail). Never had any interferenc, Thunderbrid always seems happy with sending to multiple SMTP servers and receiving from two dozen POP accounts.

First question: I'm no IT expert, and have often wondered about this. But the download pages I've used never showed an obvious choice more fine-grained Windows (though now it has a separate entry for earlier Win versions).

Anyway, I'm not sure how I got on the ESR channel - not by my choice! After making a few backups, I downloaded the latest regular release-channel version, which turns out to be 140.0.1 (64-bit). That's a lot of updates I'd apparently missed!

Good news! (to quote Professor Hubert J. Farnsworth, but without irony): it seems to be working fine on all POP channels; haven't tested all the SMTP servers yet. I don't know if it was simply too old a version for some functional compatibility, or your 64-bit observation was the culprit, or something else entirely. But OK for now, and very much relieved! Even made another donation to the volunteers here.

content:
Well, you could right-click on the shortcut to Thunderbird and look at the Properties to see where the executable is in the Target field. The default place in Windows when using the 64bit version is: "C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird\thunderbird.exe".

If you have the 32bit version installed, then it would be in the "C:\Program Files (x86)" directory instead.

content: Open your account in webmail, check the Spam/Bulk/Junk folder, unblock or whitelist any senders as needed (e.g. add them to webmail contacts). If your account is POP in TB, only Inbox is downloaded. IMAP allows download of other folders such as Spam/Bulk etc.

content: Go to settings>appearance> Which view do you have set in Message list? Try experimenting with all 3, that may solve your issue.
creator: jeff-g

content:
Thanks for the reply. I took a look at the Sorting and Threading settings. The "Unthreaded" option would appear to simply display each message as it arrives rather than by message subject. It also says "for newly created folders".

I want messages threaded, I just do not want all the threads fully expanded each time I look at that folder. I find that if I have two or three messages with long threads, they tend to fill up the message pane if they are all fully expanded.
creator: DonK

content: just occured to me that you may not have the appearance choice in your version of tbird - I'm on release 138. I believe hitting the / key will toggle expanded/not expanded - used that in the old nntp days...
creator: jeff-g

content:
I looked at the list of Keyboard Shortcuts. "*" expands all threads and "\" collapses all threads in a folder. This applies only to the currently viewed folder which remains in that state even after viewing other folders.

BTW, I was using TB version 140.0 and upgraded it to 140.0.1.
creator: DonK

content: If it isn't in the Trash folder, it's likely gone.
creator: davidsk

content:
The IN folder really brings together the inbox of several email accounts under one roof. I still have all my email accounts and their respective inboxes. At the moment I am having to check all the accounts individually.

What I was hoping is an explanation of what I would have to do to reconstruct the IN folder so I would have only one place to check all the aggregated inbox mail received. Isn't this one of the reasons to have an application like Thunderbird?

Surely there is a way!

Mark
creator: Bumblebee001

content:
Your reference to the IN folder confused me. And I"ve never seen the unified inbox in Local Folders. Try this:

  1. click view>folders and tick unified folders
  2. once that appears, rightclick, select properties and then click the 'choose' button
  3. from there, tick the inbox for each account to be added to the unified view

Let me know if that resolves the issue.
creator: davidsk

content:
rightclick on what?

I got unified folders appearing below my list of folders and accounts but nothing happens if I rightclick on it. Basically it looks like a copy of all that I already have but under a "Unified Folders" header.
creator: Bumblebee001

content: Sorry. I meant to rightclick on Unified Folders after highlighting it. The option 'properties' should appear. If not, can you post a screenshot of what you see?
creator: davidsk

content: Menu Bar Customize
creator: Bumblebee001

content: I thought there was a way to unify the IN folder from accounts settings
creator: Bumblebee001

content: No. the unified folder is a virtual folder and there are no account settings to do it. You should see 'Inbox' in left side folder pane. Rightclick on it. this is the folder you set up by clicking view>folders>unified folder. The folder pane should have the words 'Unified Folder' with Input directly below it.
creator: davidsk

content: If I right click on the Inbox under "unified folders" I get a menu as shown in the attached screenshot.
creator: Bumblebee001

content: That's right. See the entry 'properties' there that I referenced in earlier instructions? click it and then click the 'choose' button
creator: davidsk

content:
Properties: see photo.

What do I do with this??

content: Ok, your earlier deletion is causing problems. Try removing it from view>folders menu, shut down thunderbird, in profile folder, look in the Mail folder for a possible folder named 'smart mailboxes.' if present delete it. Then, restart thunderbird and reactivate the unified folder and try again with rightclick and selecting properties. We'll get through this.

creator: Bumblebee001

content: I was glad to assist. However, do you have 13 accounts? If not, my guess is you ticked the accounts, and not their folders. So, if you have fewer than 13 accounts, rightclick again there and on the 'choose' button, expand each account. Untick the account itself and just tick the inbox. when done, you will also see a unified Sent folder and a unified trash folder. For each, rightclick, select properties, and then choose.
creator: davidsk

content:
Yes. I do (almost). I have 12 email addresses but it is not so much for the addresses themselves but more as a way of providing a different address / identity when it becomes convenient or necessary to do so.

Consequently, I would have to keep track of any messages received on these addresses and act accordingly.

What I find strange is that the Sent folder has 12 ticks (Sent of each account) but still shows up as 13. Nothing else is checked as far as I can see, including the "Local Folder". (Is this Local folder necessary?)
